item.title: The goal of the Digestive Health Malaysia Society is to increase awareness of the importance of maintaining a healthy gut
item.description:
The Malaysian Ministry of Health’s 2014 Health Facts report reveals that digestive diseases are the fifth leading cause of hospital deaths in Malaysia, prompting the establishment of the Digestive Health Malaysia Society. Dato’ Dr Muhammad Radzi, Chairman of the Digestive Health Malaysia Society, highlighted that while colon cancer is widely recognized, awareness of other digestive diseases like irritable bowel syndrome, diverticulitis, gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), and Crohn’s disease remains low. item.title: The Someline Apple Tree app will produce apples for charity as long as you refrain from using your phone
item.description:
Source: Google Play. Libern Lin, a student entrepreneur attending Republic Polytechnic in Singapore, has expanded his app, Someline Apple Tree, with financial support from the Singapore Computer Society (SCS). The app incentivizes real-life interactions by rewarding users with digital apples for reducing phone usage. Lin, the app’s creator, explained that they wanted to use the app’s concept for a good cause. So, they used the S$30,000 grant from SCS to add a charitable component to the app in line with IDA’s Code for Charity*...

item.title: Abbott introduces the Freestyle Libre Pro System for glucose monitoring in India
item.description:
Research from the Asia Diabetes Foundation (ADF) indicates a growing trend of type II diabetes among young adults in Asia. A collaborative study by the ADF and Merck, called the Joint Asia Diabetes Evaluation (JADE), revealed that 18% of participants from nine Asian countries and territories were diagnosed with diabetes before the age of 40.
